text: That city they're headed to. Is that...?
Where did that bird even come from, you think?
There's a story about a great condor said to roost on an island's abandoned reactor.
Though there's no longer any way to reach the isle─or at least, none that I'm aware of.
Nature's finally reclaimin' what Shinra stole.
Well, even if we could get there, I'd rather not bother. Didn't seem very friendly.
Agreed. Let's focus on where we can go.
So all of this is Junon?
Everything above us. Below is Under Junon.
Little more than an impoverished fishing village.
Figures. Shinra's always gotta have someone to stomp on. It's their friggin' MO.
Head to Under Junon if you're looking for an inn.
Under Junon's further down, on the coast.
Welcome to Under Junon, our sunless oasis.

My name is Rhonda.
I'm the mayor and sheriff round these parts.

A woman who could turn you in...
and be a hundred grand richer for it.
Well, you know what they say... Can't take it with ya.

And Aerith to boot, huh?
That's another half a million on top.

Down here, though...
we know when to turn a blind eye.
Well, I don't think you would if you knew even half of what my town's been through.
There's a quiet little inn where everyone's welcome.
Any guys in black robes pass through?
Did see some black suits, though. Two guys and a girl. Looked pretty tough.
They made a beeline right for the elevator.
No. Don't even think about it.
In case it isn't obvious, upstairs is Shinra turf.
And the same goes for the elevator as well.
Don't ask me what, but the company's got something big planned up there, and security is tight.

You start anything─anything at all─
and there will be consequences.
Hey, you can trust me─cross my heart.
Don't care what she said─there's gotta be black robes around here somewhere. So how we gonna find them?
That would depend on where they are headed.
If they mean to continue west, there are only two ways off this continent: by sea or by air.
Might wanna ask around town, then.

Locals will know routes not on the map.
May've even seen stragglers pass through...
or got boats for rent or something.
How about we meet at the inn when we're done?
Sounds good. And remember: low profile.
Many years ago, this stretch of ocean was home to the Republic of Junon's capital.
A floating city built atop a fleet of interconnected ships.
Now, that once-proud metropolis is mere flotsam─courtesy of Shinra.
In its place, the company built a new, unsinkable city of steel...
to stand as a warning to any who might dare to oppose them. Or so I was taught.

Some fishin' village this is.
Ain't even allowed to take a rowboat out...
Shinra's saying it's only a "temporary prohibition"─but people gotta eat! Anyway...
Short of stealin' a boat and causin' a scene, both us and our black-robed friends are S.O.L.

Waters here used to be teemin' with fish.
Practically jump into your boat, way people tell it.
But ever since the offshore reactor came online, only things caught in the nets are monsters─and I ain't talkin' tuna.

Shinra just couldn't help 'emselves...
Had to go and poison the sea too.
Word around town is Shinra's holding some kinda big event up top.
The people here, they hate the lack of sunlight.

But not me. I like it this way.
Though I'd never tell them that, of course.
Elevator's our only way up, but Rhonda won't thank us if we storm it.
She wasn't kidding when she said it was well guarded. Got any other ideas?
That sword─you're some kind of fighter, aren't you?
That was Priscilla─and from the sound of it, she needs a tough guy like you to lend a hand.

We gotta go─now!
There's a monster attacking the boat!
Yuffie! Grab his fin and hold on tight!
Hey, Shinra's most wanted! Get rid of that thing!
Hey, we need help over here!
We need to get her breathing again!
Maybe someone should go find a doctor!?
Don't just stand there! Help me!
You picked the wrong girl, creep!
Those guys there are from the splinter cell.
They used to be with Avalanche, but left after a "policy dispute."

Easy; they're guests of mine.
And this one was trying to save your life.
Ugh, nice goin', Yuffie. Call the guy a creep why don'tcha, ya big moron!

Okay, Yuffie, let's get you inside.
You've had a rough day.
Not to be that guy, but kids these days, I swear...
Another one of my "guests." I seem to get a lot of them when the world's on fire.
Monsters like that one've been cropping up more and more lately. Goddamn reactor's to blame...

Thanks again.
She would've been in deep shit without you.

Thanks so much, you guys.
Those were some fancy moves!

My name's Priscilla, by the way.
Nice to meet you!
Oh, and Mr. Dolphin says thanks too.
Hey, you guys're that Avalanche splinter cell, right?
Now how the hell did you─

I just gotta say I'm a big─huge─fan of yours!
HQ wishes they could be as cool as you guys!
Well, uh, we are pretty cool, but...

Think we could sit down for a chat later?
Got a teensy favor to ask.
And gotta thank you for before!
I suppose...you could...come by the inn tomorrow?
Sweet! You won't be sorry, promise!
I know, I know─she laid it on pretty thick...

But, hey, she's just a kid.
What's the harm in hearin' her out?
C'mon, let's get ourselves some rooms.

Hey, if it isn't the heroes of the hour.
I heard about what ya did for that girl.

Your stay is on us, we insist.
It's the least we can do for you, really.

Now then, how many we got...
Will four rooms be enough?
Uh, could you make it five?

Oh, everything is comped, so if you
need anything at all, just ask.

Don't know about you,
but I'm dyin' to put my feet up.
It's nice to have the place booked up again for once.
Gosh, when was the last time that happened?

Hey, so about that Yuffie kid.
What do you think she wants with us?
"What do you think Yuffie wants with us?"

Always knew this day'd come.
Good thing my signature's a work of art.
Let me prove it to ya.
Maybe she wants to join Avalanche.
Normally, I wouldn't turn anyone away, but she's just too young.
Don't have the time─or patience─to babysit.
I'll break it to her gentle.
Could be that she's after those Shinra bounties.
Y'know, you might be right about that.

Little punk, blowin' smoke up our asses.
Oughta give her a piece of my mind.
Shinra didn't waste any time gettin' our names and faces out here, did they?
Rest up while you can. I'll let you know if anythin' happens.
I could feel them slipping away, one by one. And the tighter I held on, the more I lost.
I know. I felt the same. It was like they were sucking them straight outta my head.

And the worst part is that
I don't even know what's missing.
...Only that something is. Like, it's on the tip of my tongue, but...I just can't remember.
Speaking of, you seen them lately?
Red. Thought it was someone else.

Well, hope the rest of your patrol is
just as uneventful.
I dunno about you, but it feels like we've been on the road forever─like Midgar's ancient history.
I wonder how Mom and Marlene are holding up.
No time for that. Not with Sephiroth around.
So, a little random, but do you remember the first time we met?
"Do you remember the first time we met?"
You shoved a flower at me.
You shoved a flower in my face.
I saw it, you know, in a vase at Seventh Heaven. And I seriously doubt you're the one who put it there.

Some advice: never regift a present from a girl.
Especially if you're just gonna give it to another one.
Water under the bridge. But next time.
Oh, so close. That was the second time.
That was fun, wasn't it? Hopping from roof to roof together like that.
You're kidding. The yellow flower? Sector 8?
Ah...you and your winning sense of humor.

Where d'you think those guys in black went?
We should've seen 'em by now.
Gotta wonder what Shinra's planning up there...
Perfect timing. I was just about to come find you.
Regret what I said in Kalm.
It's fine. I never should've doubted you either.

Say, do you remember a guy named Emilio?
From Nibelheim?
"Do you remember a guy named Emilio?"
Only person from the village I remember is you.
Only person from the village I remember is you.
His family owned the general store.

Oh. Well, his family ran the general store.
Was about our age.
Anyway, he left the village right before you did.

Thought I'd never see him again, then one day
last year, he shows up at Seventh Heaven.
I couldn't believe my eyes. He was all...grown up. Didn't even recognize him at first.
Yeah, and what's more, the woman who walked in with him was stunning─like, she could've been a model, and...

Not really...
But I'm happy to listen, so go ahead.

Why deny it? I guess it was, huh?
...I'm sorry.

We'll find time to talk, just the two of us.
Figure things out.
Just be ready to spill your guts, huh!?
Think I'll turn in early tonight.
You oughta get some sleep too.
This town reeks of fish and brine.
Should Shinra come calling, I doubt I'll smell them till it's too late.
"I doubt I'll smell Shinra till it's too late."
Don't worry, never thought you could.

Thankfully, my ears are unaffected.
I'll let you know if I hear anything unusual.
It feels like I have fish bones in my nose.
Don't worry, never thought you could.
Hmph. I'll leave it all to you then.
Okay! Now that the gang's all here...
it's time you got to know me.
My name is Yuffie, materia hunter and elite ninja operative for the interim Wutai government.
I left my beloved homeland behind to bring an end to Shinra's reign of terror...
and prove that Wutai's not to be trifled with!

Yup! Which brings me to that little favor
I mentioned yesterday:
long story short─I want you to join me.
HQ? They just didn't understand─but you guys get it!

Don't ninjas creep around in the dark,
slittin' people's throats?

I mean, we've done some shit,
but we ain't about to stoop that low.
Traveling alone so far from home is expensive...
so I've been moving from town to town, hustlin'─scrapin' together enough scratch to keep stickin' it to the man.

Until, that is, I came here─and lucky I did,
because I met Rhonda.

She offered me the gig of a lifetime...
an assassination!
And guess who the target is!
Who else but a certain company's new president...
And that douchebag'll be here any minute now.
These people had their country stolen from them, and then their sunlight! Junon demands revenge!
So when the president steps out...
Okay. You wanna know how Rhonda's plannin' on payin' me? With your bounty, suckers!
Wow, gotta hand it to her! The lady works fast!
I know you're in there, my friend!

If you manage to get away,
you should try to find Priscilla.
Now, now! You don't want to make me come in there and fetch you! Because I would love to do it!
A pain in the ass. Let's go.
Come on out! It's been far too long since I've looked you in the eye!
My, my, aren't we a tease?
Honestly! How long do you intend to keep me waiting?
What light from yonder balcony breaks? Come on down and say hello!

Absence certainly makes
the heart grow fonder, my friend!
Still playing hard to get, eh?
Well, I've got news for you, young man!
As if by fate, the Speed Demon has been entrusted with a singular task:

Hahahaha!
It only takes two to tango.
Besides, you and I like to go big...
and a venue this small just won't do.
But no need to worry. I've found the perfect stage.
The city above─where we can dance up a storm!
Seek me out, and we'll put our last performance to shame, with a show none shall ever forget!
You got some weird friends, man.
We might wanna think about getting out of here. These people don't need more trouble.
Yuffie said to talk to Priscilla if we wanted to get topside, right? Let's go find her.
Thanks for dealing with that Shinra nutjob.
Don't you think for even a second we did that for you─the slimeball who sold us out.
Take it. Not much, but it's yours.
The hell's this s'posed to be?
Your bounty... Part of it, anyway.
You thought I'd put you through the wringer like that without makin' it worth your while?
We're on the same side. Always have been.
And what if biker boy had taken us in!?

Then I would've had to improvise.
But I didn't, 'cause it all worked out.
Worked out fine...like I pray it will for Yuffie upstairs.
Wanna know somethin' funny? All the materia in my house up and poofed.
Someone must've made off with it.
I wasn't using it anyway, but still...
Not to point fingers, but pretty sure it was Yuffie.
Oh, Priscilla? Last I saw, she was headin' to the cove.
We talked to Yuffie. She said that you could show us a way to get up top.
Although...Yuffie's the one who found it.
And according to her, that tanker's the quickest and easiest way into the city!
See that? That booth up there's the control room.
So we can repurpose the ship as an elevator.

Someone lowers and sends it back up─
along with the others.

Problem is, how're we supposed to
get to the controls?
Yep. It should just say: "No climbing."
You wouldn't believe what he can do! Like...

Like when we met!
See, I was out taking a swim all on my lonesome!
At least, I thought I was alone, but then─squeak, squeak─I hear this funny noise!
That's great and all, but we're in a hurry.

But we'll make sure to come back as soon as we're done. You can finish your story then.
How does that sound?
Now we ask Mr. Dolphin to get you up!
With his help, it'll be a cinch.
Okay! Which one of you wants to go flying?
Got you written all over it, merc.
Great! Just lemme know when you're ready to go.

Good to go?
You will not be able to return to Under Junon for some time.
The ship's not far, so you'll be there in no time!
If we don't sink on the way...
You've been a huge help, Priscilla!
Well, guys and girls! And, uh...dog! I'll seeya later!
Hey! Merc! We're good to go down here!

Guess things have changed.
They got higher priorities.
Personally, I think that's a good thing.

This city's size, on the other hand...
The robed men won't be easy to find.
Well, they're definitely not here. Let's head into town.

Shinra's pride and joy.
The fastest, most advanced airship in the fleet.
Screw the boat. Let's take that.
'Less you got a trained crew and piloting skills we don't know about...
That's too bad. Would've been perfect.
No. We'll leave them be─for now.

An emissary from Wutai is here─
sent by Viceroy Sarruf.
He introduced himself as Colonel Glenn Lodbrok.
Let's cut to the chase, Mr. President.

The viceroy and your late father had big plans.
I assume you intend to carry them out?

That's good to hear─some people
just don't have the stomach for war.
And this battle for the magnus materia demands commitment from both Wutai and Shinra.
But my father is dead─which changes the equation.

You always did prefer to march
to the beat of your own drum.

This "new vision" include your
fairy-tale promised land?

You Shinras...
You take and you take, and you never give back.
Left to you, this world would end up an empty husk.

But war can put things right─beget anger,
desolation, hatred─and in its wake, new unity.

A people rejuvenated...
and a planet once more made whole.

What we're doing's for the greater good.
Just gotta know when to ease off the gas.

No more playing the idle heir.
You have obligations to fulfill.
Let's give the people what they deserve.
Oh, right! Before I leave...a message from the viceroy.
Congratulations on your inauguration, Mr. President. Shinra has a bright future.
So, Cloud! What can you tell us about Junon?
It's a key military outpost with its own offshore reactor.
A critical line of defense against any seaborne assault. When needed, it can transform into an armed fortress.
Its strategic location, along with its air and seaports, make it second only to Midgar as the company's most vital city.

Huh, neat.
Any good restaurants? Sights to see?
Ah, right. You're not the touristy type.
Hey... Just to be clear, you do realize we're not here on vacation, right?
Listen up! Midgar's Seventh Infantry will return home with the president's commendation!
Let's show him how a real drill team does it...
Troopers! You're all off duty until the parade begins!
But use this time wisely. Practice your technique!
Those troopers seemed pretty psyched for the parade, huh?

More like, "eager to prance around for
their new paymaster."
Now I know what y'all gonna say...but I gotta ask.
If Rufus is in town, are we really gonna let this opportunity pass us by?
Hell, I'm not sayin' we kill the man─but we oughta at least give him a talkin' to. Rough him up a little maybe, y'know?
Actually, I'm gonna have to agree.

First the Turks say,
"Do whatever─we're not after you."
But then Cloud's biker buddy rolls up and says he is. We gotta straighten this out.
We can't just walk up to the president in the street.
No, that's how we die in a hail of bullets like a bunch of dumbasses. The city's crawling with Shinra troopers.
We join the parade. Hide in plain sight.
Get in, get close, get answers.

Barret, Red. You guys find a route to the port;
see what security's like.

And keep an eye out for black robes
while you're at it.
Fatigues won't be enough to disguise you two.
Alright, see you in a bit. I gotta go find a uniform.

Attention all troopers!
Spare uniforms can be found here!
The ceremony will be starting soon!
Are you part of the parade today?

You should know you can't go out wearing that.
Get changed─quickly.

Why aren't you in uniform yet?
Your team's gonna march without you.
Whoa there! Three steps back, if you please!
Uh, Cloud? What d'you think you're doing?
If you're gonna stand there, keep watch.
C'mon, Cloud. You really need to be this close?
I'd say we look the part.
Maybe, but don't forget: you gotta act the part too. Just do what I do, alright?
Head to Starboard Junon when you're ready.
Better hurry. You don't want to be the reason your team is disqualified.
It's the damnedest thing, but I don't recall seeing the three of you at practice. Am I to assume that you simply...forgot?
Do you have any idea how important today's ceremony is? Do you, maggot!?
Form check─now! You will give your commander a flawless performance.
And if you show her anything less than perfection...
I'll feed your ass to a behemoth!
Just follow my lead. I still remember the basics.
I'm having second thoughts, you guys.

What the hell are you doing over there!?
The commander is waiting!
Have to hand it to you three. You've got guts skipping out on practice─that, or you're idiots.

Let's find out, shall we?
I'm not about to take any chances today.
I'm warning you now, though... One slip up, and I'll chuck you straight into a malboro's mouth.
Let's see what you've got. Now...begin!
Let's see what you've got. Now...begin!
Is this a game to you!?
I must say, you've impressed me.
He'd serve as a sterling example to the others, ma'am.

Congratulations. You are hereby promoted to
parade captain of Midgar's Seventh Infantry.
You will be our model trooper─the one to march at the head of our drill team!
Which means that our performance─satisfactory or otherwise─is now your responsibility.
As parade captain, you will round up your fellow troopers currently on leave in Larboard Junon.
You will recall that, to march in the parade, each drill team is required to muster five units or more.

Look for the Seventh's brassards.
They'll identify the best from the rest.
Once assembled, you and the team will report to Starboard Junon.

Tardiness will not be tolerated.
Now, make us proud!
So you'd better not blow it─Captain.
Hmph─ Still haven't assembled your team, Captain?
I'm sure some of your fellow troopers fell into a bottle or two. Try the bars around town.
A few might have decided to visit Junon's most famous sight.
No doubt some are trying to calm themselves by taking in the ocean view.
Could be that a few troopers are wandering Junon's famed shopping district.
Apparently, there's a life-size cutout of President Rufus somewhere in town. Check there.
Get your team in order, Captain.

Hey, you sure about this?
Is the parade really gonna get us to Rufus?

The parade won't...
but the presidential commendation will.

That's how these things go.
The president himself gives the award.
That's some plan. I mean, it's risky, but...
Gotta go big or go home, right?
Ready to rally the troops, Captain?
Yeah. Just remember: Midgar, Seventh Infantry.
Anyone with one of these guys, right?
The parade's gonna be broadcast live in Midgar...
So we gotta show up and show out. Give the folks back home somethin' to believe in, right!?
Get your shit together; parade's about to begin. Everyone, follow me!

Shave it clean and make it gleam─
Gleam like the midday sun♪

Buff it fine and make it shine─
Shine bright for everyone♪

If you wanna drink with us,
you're gonna have to lose the helmets.
What are you waiting for? Unless...
Wait! He's our new captain; he didn't know!

Sir, this place is for the clean-shaven.
You need to prove that you belong or leave.
R & R's over, people. Seventh, outside!
Hey─if you want to drink here, the helmet has to go.
This establishment only caters to those who boldly bare their baldness.
You're participating in the president's inauguration parade? Good luck.
So yeah─once the parade's over, I'll be officially joining the counter-terrorism unit.
I know... They haven't even told me where I'm gonna be stationed.
This sucks... Well, we'll just have to make the most of the time we got.

Can we help you?
We're kind of in the middle of something.

Oh god... Talk about humiliating.
Rude probably hates me...Boss must wanna fire me...
Damn, look at the size of that thing. It's bigger than big; it's humongous!
And totally worthless. We haven't used it in years...not since the war.
An instrument of death, laid to rest! Huh. There is something kinda poetic about that.
What? We're trying to enjoy the view.
Get your shit together; parade's about to begin. Everyone, follow me!
It's past time the president showed himself. Where's he been?
Not in Midgar, that's for sure. Seeing the world maybe?
Good. Kid's got a lot to learn.
True that. I doubt he's got any idea what Midgar units can do.
Guess we just gotta go out there and "introduce" ourselves.
Captain! I didn't realize! Sorry, sir!
Practice is over. Time for the real deal. With me.
How excited are you to participate in today's parade?
Very. All of us in the Seventh have been practicing like crazy. Day in and day out, drilling every little detail.
I just hope that hard work comes through in our performance, and that it gives everyone who came out to support our new president something else to cheer about.
But before we let you go, is there anything you'd like to say to the folks back in Midgar?
This is a...difficult time for our city...
but when you see us marching today, just know this:

Oh... Excuse me, but we're
in the middle of an interview.
Uh─ Oh, you're their captain! This is perfect!
I'd love to ask you some questions about the parade.
How do you plan to set your team apart from the competition? Are there any special routines you've been practicing?
Whoa... Right! I see what you mean, Captain.
We can't go spilling our secrets to anyone who asks─especially on camera!
Break time's over, people. The parade's about to begin. Follow me!
Excuse me, sir? Do you think you could spare a minute?
Yes, you! Did you come to Junon to watch the parade?
No, but I happened to be here on business, so I figured I'd stick around!
To, uh...witness the dawning of a glorious new era for our company!
Then I'm sure the inauguration has a personal significance for you.
What can you tell us about our new president?
Well, he's very young─but qualified! Very qualified! Just the man to bring us peace and prosperity!
And may I say what an honor it is to work under such a born leader─and to contribute to his success!
Um...is this being broadcast in Midgar?
It is! Why do you ask?
I was just wondering if I could say a few words to my daughter maybe?
Look, honey! It's me! Daddy's on television!
I miss you very, very much, but I promise I'll be home real soon!
Oh! And I got to see the cannon!
And it was so big! Way bigger than in your picture books!
I only wish you and Mommy were here to see it with me.
So you know what? Next family vacation, we'll all come here together!
I'm bringing back a ton of presents, so make sure to finish your homework! And your chores! And listen to Mommy!
And don't play too much Fort Condor.
That's all we have time for...
Oh, just a few more seconds!
They've got everything! Shame I can't take this baby home.
But you know, the smaller one's a real beauty too.
The masterworks mako cannon? Oh yeah, it's as good as bought!
That's what I'm talkin' about! Can't find it anywhere else.
Man, I can't wait to put it together.

Lemme guess: you're here
for the limited model too?
Not yet! Let me fangirl for a sec.
Fangirl a little toward the middle then, would ya?
Sorry, Mr. President! Don't mind me.
C'mon! You gonna pose or what?
Oh, perfect timing, Captain! Would you mind taking the picture so I can get in there?
Oh, wow, this is... This is really something, sir.
This looks great! Can't wait to share it.

Wow, Captain... Who knew you were such a pro!?
I might just have to frame this!
Break time's over, people. The parade's about to begin. Follow me!
Hey, whaddya think about this brooch?
D'you think my girlfriend would like it?
Let me take a closer look.
This brooch has two machine guns on it, and you want to give it to your girlfriend? Bro.
Yeah, you're right. I should go with the two bayonets.
I'm picking out a present for my girlfriend.
Which do you think she'd like more: the machine gun brooch, or the bayonet one?
Don't bother the captain with your bullshit! Sorry, sir, he's being an idiot.
R & R's over, people. Seventh, outside!
Call me biased if you wish, but I believe our Ifrit Formation is the pinnacle of perfection.
I dunno... The grenadiers' Ramuh is pretty tight too.
Nothing beats the riot troopers' Shiva Formation. It's rock solid!
Hm... If only we could come up with a formation that allowed all of our troops to shine, the president's commendation would be as good as ours.
Sir! Permission to ask a question?

What formations do you intend
to utilize for our performance?
That depends on the readiness of my men.
But you can rest assured that your captain has everything under control.
Ready to move when you are, sir!
Hope you had a restful stay, sir!
Got some fine folios there, Captain!
Looking forward to a celebratory drink, sir!
All troopers present and accounted for, sir!

As we march...the eyes of the whole world...
will be...watching us.
And we cannot─we will not─let our great city of Midgar down!
It's a big ask. But we can do it! Together!

Because we have our captain to guide us!
Look to him─trust in him─and he will lead us to victory, so long as we follow!
Today is our day. It was made for the Seventh Infantry! We will win that commendation for our city!
And we will return home as champions!
Who's gonna show the rest of them how it's done!?
Captain. The parade's about to start.
No way. Is that who I think it is?
Hey there! I was just checking my uniform. For lint! Y'all know how it is!
Hah hah, very funny. I coulda shot you!
It's not like I had a choice! Nothing else fit!

Anyway, I checked out the way to the port.
And y'all, uh...
We're gonna win the president's commendation.
Think ya mean "I'm rooting for you."
There's a lotta troopers in town, especially by the port. 'Cause of the crowds no doubt.
Long as we keep our heads down, we'll be okay.
Wasn't feelin' it at first, but I'm startin' to appreciate the sheer audacity of us playin' dress-up!
Aw, how'd you know it was us?
That is some nose you got there, Red.
Leaving the mako-soaked streets of Midgar behind has done wonders for my faculties.
